title: WHEN you rework Shyvana, Riot...
body:
Not if, WHEN, because you can't help yourselves.

Show restraint. As she is her numbers are fine and her builds are diverse. She has clearly defined strengths and weaknesses. 

The ONLY things {{champion:102}}  needs;

1. Build Rage while respawning so she can rejoin critical team fights mid to late game

2. Tenacity built into her Dragon form


Please for the love of God, Allah, Yaweh, Vishnu, Buddah, and The Flying Spaghetti Monster do NOT listen to people requested entire overhauls on her kit and basically asking for her to be replaced, like Aatrox, and absolutely do not cave to your own urges to constantly "make things better" like how you do with Ryze, Akali, Garen, Yuumi, etc...

_**SHOW RESTRAINT**_. I implore you, Riot.

replies.body: What kills me when people ask that old champions that are still good be reworked is why they aren't simply suggesting their changes as a NEW and SEPARATE champion that doesn't screw with one of my mains!
Because Shyvanna isn't good and should have her entire kit reworked.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Saltarin,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZRfkn1Jv,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-12-22T00:23:22.182+0000)
>
> Because Shyvanna isn't good and should have her entire kit reworked.

Cept she shouldn't. It's a great and straight forward kit as it is. What would help it is more Tenacity on her dragon form and for her to recharge rage while respawning so she can rejoin the fight without senseless farming up.
bump
Make her hot on the rework.
She's already pretty hot ;)

>
> She's already pretty hot ;)

She could stand to be a bit more scatily robed. She's not quite waifu material just yet. Morgana was made into prime waifu material.

But Shyvana would obviously be better if her Q conjured a massive flaming claw swipe that alternates casts from her left and right arm, W was a dash with three charges that reset if you hit an enemy champion from the sides, E was a mini dragon form that empowered her other abilities for 2 seconds increased by 1 with every auto or champion spell hit up to 5.5 seconds, and her ult gave her map-wide presence in some way. That would surely be a fun, balanceable homage that would bring in new Shyvana players while not alienating current ones, and definitely wouldn't need to be gutted after a month.

Her numbers are not fine though?

Lets look at Winrates and pickrates for each elo in the jungle.

* Iron : 44% winrate and 3% pickrate.
* Bronze : 47.5% W 2.4% P 
* Silver : 50% W 2% P 
* Gold ; 50.6% W 2% P
* Plati : 49% W 1.7% P
* Dia : 46.7% W 1.2% P
* Masters : 43% W 0.7% P


So out of 7 divisions of play she is pretty much a trollpick in 4 of them, and barely hanging on to being decent in 2 while kind of bad but not terrible in another thanks to dedicated players.

However at what cost? Her AD build is essentially dead with only 3 out of 10 players using it compared to the AP one in the elo´s where she is viable, statistical sites like OP.GG or U.GG or league of graphs do not even show the AD builds anymore.

Her numbers are fine? Her builds diverse?

Sir OP you are factually wrong, statistics are entirely against you and it´s beyond crystal clear that Shyvana needs a large overhaul if she is going to have either of the things you claim that she does.



Now i can understand the fear of her becoming the new Akali/Irelia/Azir who keeps getting nerfed over and over or get things taken out of their kits post rework after rework until the original champion is hardly visible but something major needs to happen.

Because right now it´s beyond clear that the half Dragon is like a rotting corpse tossed into a underground lake with no way out, left to slowly decay into nothingness.

She needs major changes to have the ability to get out that pit, so a rework is necessary with in depth work and several changes to essentially replace or greatly alter her kit because that´s where origin of her sickness festers.

Not every champ has to be pick up and be a god with it. It is hard to keep on top of people, people are used to being spoonfed mobility. That means people are likely to pick her up and drop her before learning to adapt to playing something that doesn't allow a mobility handicap.

Base win %s don't say it all. You need to dig deeper. This person is 70% win rate with AD Shyv in masters. Yeah, people have opted more for the burst shyv it's true, but don't pretend they're not both options because they ARE.

I'll admit, it takes a lot of global jg knowledge to really pull her off due to lack of mobility, but her numbers ARE fine.

P.S. I've played her as both AD and AP (more AD than AP, but since AP junglers are weak, it gives her a nice niche pick on an AD heavy team), and without a ton of experience on her did 50/50 in clash with no complaints from my team as AD (all my rank or higher, they told me to stick with her because it works when I asked if I should change based on enemy team). I attribute this to me being comfortable in the jungle and really knowing my paths to compensate for her lack of ability to stick to opponents well. This type of pathing took me a LOT of experience to learn in general. Shyv is fine.

Even Nightblue3 now famous for flipping out over troll picks plays Shyvana AD in grandmasters.

Global win rates of a champion rarely reflect win rates of people that are proficient with them, but proficient win rates DO matter.

Also you say she's trollpick in 4/7 divisions...80% of players are in the 3 divisions you say she's not a trollpick in also 47.5% is hardly "trollpick" just a bit low. Add that and it's 93% of the playerbase... So that'd make her trollpick in 20% of the playerbase according to you, 7% according to me based on that stat. However, people at the top have proven they can excel with her, and people at the bottom that do would drag themselves out of the bottom...

I find your argument ridiculous. You claim to use stats but you really don't dig deep beyond what suits your argument, all while arguing with people that PLAY her.

And i do play her additionally, in fairly recent times i have 36 games on her with a 61.8% winrate so i do think i know what i am on about. 

And before you comment on the winrates,  i am making these arguments exactly because i did not win because i was playing Shyvana well, what i did was jungle better than my opponents for the most part and abuse the existence of dumb opponents. 

This was the case since she has almost no room for skill expression, her main ganking pattern is either just runs up to someone and auto attacks them or she ults down on them and does it, or maybe she first runs up then she ults.....

My success was also attributed to the presently overpowered Dragons, a careless jungler who lets their opponents farm those for free has basically tossed the game hard unless he snowballs all his lanes like hell, but truth be told in any of those games i would have been stronger if i had been playing another champion like Vi, Elise or even Sejuani, but i just did not because i happen to like Shyv despite her defects.

And thankfully my MMR is not high enough to regularly encounter opponents who make playing her with success nigh impossible, perhaps so thanks to me being terrible at Irelia which drags down my MMR significantly as i keep playing her.

But when i still played my main champs more seriously it was a bit higher, i´ll leave an image to show why i think i know what i am doing.

Enemy jungle was a masters Seju and i tossed her like a sallad simply because her jungling skills were worse than mine, a single step behind became as impossible to cross as a hundred miles.

Since the goal from the very start is to have all champions be either generally viable or rewarding to master, Shyvana at this time is neither which is statistically proven since the masters cant make her work generally.
I disagree I don't want diversity for her build paths since that ALWAYS mades balance problems. I think riot should get rid of ap all together.

While I agree they should show some restraint. I think it should be Warwick level. Not very different from the current iteration yet feels better to play. 
Her rework, when it happens, should be **focusing on the juggernaut aspect**. I would dare to say that her AP build shouldn't stay the same. It might still exist but the way the ratio are it should be more spread up. (i.e. The long range E spam must be deleted)
 If the AP build can't work it's fine. I'd prefer her to be focusing on being a dragon leaving flames and bodies along her path into the fray than a Gargoyle spitting fireballs from the other side of the river.

She's one of what's become a vast minority of champions that has either an engage, or disengage but not both. She's not allowed to make mistakes like many other champions. I'll be honest, I'm pretty new to her, but I like her because the JG is almost all hypercarries right now and she just feels more well thought out and deeper than right click which is my problem with the current JG. It's boring, she's not. No one with half a brain wants to play Yi (or a right click champ) every game.

Let me just add that no one can be truly great with a champion until they master multiple styles with them. Take Amumu, if you look at the top players it's tank amumus and AP amumus, then above them, people that play BOTH.

I'm not completely against it. I'm fine with having a possibility for AP build BUT it needs to be spread out and just not a blatant point & spam ability. 

Amumu as you pointed out is a great tank and a decent full AP build for fun. So is Zac (even tho is AP build is rarer). Sejuani was very fun to play as AP before the tank update. If you take a look at champion closer to Shyvana's class (fighter). Vi is an interesting example who  can do Assassin / Bruiser / Tank. If you take an even closer look at subclass (juggernaut). Garen is a great example at a juggernaut who can both be played AD or tank. It just needs to be done right. And the current iteration of Shyvana makes it so AP isn't right (to me).

I met a fair amount of shyvana AP and, most of the time they're ulting on the side or backwards to better spam their E. 
But when they can fly into most of the enemy team and W they do it. ANd when they do it usually mean it's an easy double/triple kill. While it cna be wonderful to you, I still think it's quite unhealthy, her spells aren't as telegraph as most ranged AP and way more forgiving since, unless I'm mistaking, it's "ground" targeted (it stops at enemy champion or when reaching the location right?). In that case it can be landed very easily for how high the damage are.
